description: Ms. leaves. Title supplied by cataloger. Physical description: Number of lines per page varies. European paper of several types and various size, including paper with "Tre Lune" watermark. Some leaves are re-used pieces of paper, one with a list of goods purchased in English. Leaves at the beginning of the gathering are badly damaged by rodents and other animals or insects, with important loss of text. Origin: From Sub-Saharan Africa. Incipit of Text 1 (fol. 1a): بسم ... وصلى الله على من لا نبر بعده قال يا الله مديتما دومج شاح معا
abstract: Gathering of loose leaves of Sub-Saharan provenance, containing prayers, invocations, description and use of talismans, amulets, and magic squares. The leaves are placed between two pieces of animal skin, the top piece with hair (175 x 120 mm.).
title: [Collection of prayers and talismans].
subject: Islamic magic—Formulae, receipts, prescriptions
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
